text: "Thougal Jagoi" () literally, means the "Dance of dedication ") or "Jagoi Ashangbi" () is a Meitei traditional dance form, performed by men and women, along with maibis (priestesses) to invoke the deities. It is performed in the religious festival of Lai Haraoba. The performance lasts for half an hour, after which the "Hoi Lauba" ceremony is enacted. ==References== Category:Jagoi
title: Thougal Jagoi
